Articles.Content:
In this challenge, you have to safely land on the Mun using only 2 stages!

Rules:

1. Only 2 stages! (Each stage must only have 1 part!) that means only 2 parts can come off your ship when you go there! (anything in utilities/control tabs do not count as a part unless there is a tie.

2. Your ship cant take any damage!

3. Your Kerbal has to plant a flag on the Mun to win. If more then two people make it, whoever has the least parts wins

4. Stock parts only!

5. If you make it back you get $5000 imaginary dollars! (in not sure if this part is possible)

6. YES THIS IS POSSIBLE!

7. Post pics/vids of your ship and adventures!

8. The decoppler dose not count, neither the the rocket, sorry about not explaining that. but you cant have more then one rocket!

9. a part is anything you can click on in the VAB!

score so far

1 5thHorseman with 6 parts

Edited November 4, 2013 by krona14

I think you'll have to clarify rule #1. 2 stages and 2 parts are entirely different things. If only 2 parts are allowed to be decoupled that would mean a single fuel tank and its fuel line. Is that how you intended this challenge, a single drop tank?

If you mean two staging events, as in two decouplers, that would be an entirely different thing.

As for #6, yes it's possible. It's almost not even challenging if you know how to make SSTOs, or if your "2 stages" rule is for stages and not individual parts.

YES THIS IS POSSIBLE!

I know it is possible but you should probably still come with your own example.

I think you'll have to clarify rule #1. 2 stages and 2 parts are entirely different things. If only 2 parts are allowed to be decoupled that would mean a single fuel tank and its fuel line. Is that how you intended this challenge, a single drop tank?

If you mean two staging events, as in two decouplers, that would be an entirely different thing.

As for #6, yes it's possible. It's almost not even challenging if you know how to make SSTOs, or if your "2 stages" rule is for stages and not individual parts.

Each stage must only have 1 part except the last part, batteries/electronics don,t count as a part except in the event of a tie and pretty much everything in the control/utilities section.

I don't understand the rules. You say only two stages allowed, but that each stage can only consist of 1 part. As a minimum I imagine a stage will need two parts - fuel and an engine. Or am I just being a bit thick?

So basically, you can have 2 engines/fuel tanks/structural parts/science parts decouple from your ship. Yeah, no. You're gonna have a hard time getting to the Mun only being able to decouple an engine and its one fuel tank.

Maybe you should really think through the rules first. A normal stage needs at least three parts - fuel tank, engine, and decoupler. Unless you can get to the mun using decoupler impulse only. That would be really a challenge.

Fuel pipe counts as a part or not? What about struts?

At present I believe the sure-fire approach is to build a SSTM. The final part doesn't count, right? So if I don't stage at all it's alright. There were a few nice designs for hard mode of recent Reddit SSTO challenge...
A decoupler is a structure part... how is it possible to make a single part stage without one?

A decoupler is a structure part... how is it possible to make a single part stage without one?

You can use a docking port and decouple fuel tanks that way.

Cupcake...
Ok, I need to see krona's attempt, you NEED AT LEAST 3 parts per stage, one tank cant even get you to the small island south of the KSC, let alone the Mun...

You can use a docking port and decouple fuel tanks that way.

Cupcake...

I thought about that already but I don't think you can tie a docking port to a stage event, unless I misunderstood.

Dunno, I thought if something comes off the ship it counts as a stage. I'm not sure how else you do it really.

Cupcake...

Dunno, I thought if something comes off the ship it counts as a stage. I'm not sure how else you do it really.

Cupcake...

Ohhh derp! Just turn the coupler around so it stays on the parent craft. I play KSP gud!

I'm in the midst of a 6-part run, where I drop an orange tank and Skipper and take the other 4 parts (to be revealed later) to the Mun and back. I'm working on the landing part now but I should have plenty of Delta V. Not sure if I can land back on Kerbin yet but I *could* make it 7 parts and add a parachute.

Ohhh derp! Just turn the coupler around so it stays on the parent craft. I play KSP gud!

Ah... Yes.... I'll get my coat.

Cupcake...

Technically this is a failure because I damaged the craft. But after a dozen tries and quite literally hitting the ground with 0 velocity (plus or minus 1 m/s) and 0 fuel (plus or minus 0 fuel), the ship fell over and the fuel tank exploded.

But when I touched the ground the ship was intact.

I may try this again with my 7th part a parachute, but it was pretty trying and I'm not sure I want to go through it again

Javascript is disabled. View full album
I think that was pretty good.

Oh, and I should say:

I have no idea what this means:

(Each stage must only have 1 part!) that means only 2 parts can come off your ship when you go there! (anything in utilities/control tabs do not count as a part unless there is a tie.

And this clarification just confused me more:

Each stage must only have 1 part except the last part, batteries/electronics don,t count as a part except in the event of a tie and pretty much everything in the control/utilities section.

So I just made my ship with as few parts as I could and made sure the launcher stage only had 2 parts.

I think the problem is you're using the word "part" to mean at least 2 different things. A "part" is anything you can select in the VAB. You should reword the challenge so that any time the word "part" is in there, you mean exactly that.

It has already been shown in the past that the minimum number of parts is five:

command pod + fuel tank + LV-N

- no decoupler -

orange fuel tank + Skipper engine

The heat produced by the LV-N is used to destroy the orange tank when empty, and thus stage.

There you go.

It has already been shown in the past that the minimum number of parts is five:

command pod + fuel tank + LV-N

- no decoupler -

orange fuel tank + Skipper engine

The heat produced by the LV-N is used to destroy the orange tank when empty, and thus stage.

There you go.

So assuming my ship otherwise wins (if my "parts" match what the OP meant by "parts"), my addition of a decoupler due to the requirement to not damage anything should mean that 6 parts is the absolute minimum here.

So assuming my ship otherwise wins (if my "parts" match what the OP meant by "parts"), my addition of a decoupler due to the requirement to not damage anything should mean that 6 parts is the absolute minimum here.

Yup, sorry I overlooked the no damage part. Happy Dia De Muertos!
The decoppler dose not count, neither the the rocket, sorry about not explaining that. but you cant have more then one rocket!

Make the description more clear or nobody will be able to do it.
